News.headline: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 0 York City
News.page_title: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 0 York City
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 0 York City
News.short_description: Dagenham & Redbridge left it late to record a vital 1-0 win at home to York City in the National League
News.description:
Daggers made six changes for the clash, with Curtley Williams, Josh Staunton, Luke Guttridge, Luke Howell, Elliott Romain and Paul Benson coming in to the starting XI.

There was also a start for skipper Scott Doe, who was making his 300th appearance for Daggers.

In the seventh minute, Benson had a header saved following a good ball into the box from full-back Joe Widdowson.

Two minutes later, Benson saw a header cleared off the line following a corner from Guttridge.

York, though, created several chances themselves with Jon Parkin, Adriano Moke and Amari Morgan-Smith all going close in a first half which ended goalless.

Corey Whitely missed a good chance for Daggers in the 58th minute, unable to get a clean connection on the ball after a great cross from Romain.

In the 72nd minute, Romain was unable to head home his first goal for the club after a superb cross from Williams.

At the other end seven minutes later, Elliot Justham was tested by a venoumous half-volley from Asa Hall.

With seven minutes remaining, Daggers took the lead with a great, curled effort from the edge of the area by substitute Frankie Raymond.

It proved to be the gameâ€™s only goal as Daggers returned to winning ways in front of their home fans.

Attendance: 1659 of which 109 were away

Line Ups:

Daggers: Justham, Widdowson, Doe (c), Robson, Howell, Romain, Guttridge (78' Raymond) , Whitely, Staunton, Benson, Williams

Daggers Unused Subs: Cousins, Maguire Drew, Robinson, Ling

York City: Loach, Whittle, Heslop (c), Morgan-Smith (78' Muggleton), Hall (87' Connolly), Oliver, Parkin, Newton, Moke (87' Fenwick), Parslow, Bencherif

York City Unused Subs: Rooney, Holmes
